intro: Wendlandia uvariifolia subsp. chinensis, commonly known as the Chinese bellflower, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, often reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a slightly hairy surface, while its stems are erect and branching. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories or along stream banks.
